life expectancy.translation[0].definitio: the length of time that a person or animal is expected to live
the length of time that something is expected to continue to work, be useful etc
life expectancy.translation[1].definitio: the age someone will probably live to, used by insurance companies when working out the risk of insuring them
Sixty-year-old men who still smoke have a life expectancy of less than 12 years.
the average number of years that something such as an electrical product will last
